alert.note: Alert for Mendocino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 31 at 4:24AM PST until February 01 at 8:00PM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Eureka CA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in California... Russian River near Hopland affecting Mendocino County. For the Russian River...including Hopland...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO TOMORROW EVENING... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD WATCH... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Russian River near Hopland. * WHEN...From this evening to tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Flooding of Highway 222 near Ukiah. Secondary roads in low-lying areas will be flooded in the Hopland, Ukiah, and Talmage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:45 AM PST Wednesday the stage was 3.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 21.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 3.8 feet early this morning. It will then fall to 3.3 feet late this morning. It will rise above flood stage this evening to 18.3 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning to 6.7 feet Saturday evening. It will then rise again but remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.2 feet on 03/09/1995. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (4 am PST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Russian River Hopland 15.0 3.7 Wed 3 am PST 17.5 9.8 7.3 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at weather.gov/eka. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 430 PM PST.
